hints_html: Do row operations to simplify the computation.
hints_latex: Do row operations to simplify the computation.
hints_raw: Do row operations to simplify the computation.
question: A 30
sols_html:
Let \(\Delta\) be the determinant. Using the fact that adding and subtracting rows from one another within a matrix does not affect the value of the determinant, we subtract the first row from each of the remaining rows:

\[\begin{aligned} \Delta = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\ 1 & 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\ \end{array}\right]\right| = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 4 \\ \end{array}\right]\right|.\end{aligned}\]

Now we notice that the resulting matrix is upper-triangular, and thus the determinant is just the product of the entries on the diagonal: \(\Delta = 1 \times 1 \times 3 \times 2 \times 4 = 24\).
sols_latex:
Let $\Delta$ be the determinant. Using the fact that adding and
subtracting rows from one another within a matrix does not affect the
value of the determinant, we subtract the first row from each of the
remaining rows:

\begin{align*}
\Delta = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\
1 & 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\
 \end{array}\right]\right| = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 0 & 3 & 2 & 1 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 4 \\
 \end{array}\right]\right|.
\end{align*}

Now we notice that the resulting matrix is upper-triangular, and thus
the determinant is just the product of the entries on the diagonal:
$\Delta = 1 \times 1 \times 3 \times 2 \times 4 = 24$.
sols_raw:
Let <math>\Delta</math> be the determinant. Using the fact that adding and subtracting rows from one another within a matrix does not affect the value of the determinant, we subtract the first row from each of the remaining rows:
:<math>

\Delta = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\
1 & 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\
 \end{array}\right]\right| = \left|\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
0 & 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 0 & 3 & 2 & 1 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 2 & 3 \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 4 \\
 \end{array}\right]\right|.
</math>

Now we notice that the resulting matrix is upper-triangular, and thus the determinant is just the product of the entries on the diagonal:
<math>
\Delta = 1 \times 1 \times 3 \times 2 \times 4 = 24
</math>.
statement_html:
Find the determinant of the matrix

\[\begin{aligned} \left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\ 1 & 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\ \end{array}\right].\end{aligned}\]
statement_raw:
Find the determinant of the matrix 

:<math>
\left[\begin{array}{ccccc} 
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 1 \\
1 & 2 & 3 & 4 & 5 \\
1 & 1 & 4 & 3 & 2 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 3 & 4 \\
1 & 1 & 1 & 1 & 5 \\
 \end{array}\right]
</math>.
